授業目的:
The purpose of this course is to build oral communication skills. Students will improve their speaking and listening ability through a variety of activities, including listening and note-taking, making recordings, shadowing, and giving presentations. The goals of this course are:

• To equip students with English speaking and listening skills
• To provide students with guidance and practice in basic conversation
• To develop students’ academic listening, speaking and presentation skills
到達目標:
Learning Goals
These are the specific goals for the spring semester. Spring semester skills to be developed:

1. Group Discussion Skills
a. Expressing ideas, asking for information or clarification
b. Giving reasons, evaluating ideas
c. Agreeing and disagreeing
d. Communication strategies
e. Negotiation strategies
f. Debate strategies

2. Presentation/Speaking Skills
a. Speech preparation and practice
b. Speech delivery
c. Speaking fluency, pronunciation, and intonation

評価.成績評価Grading2:
備考　Note
You will be graded on the following activities:
1. Unit 5 and Unit 6 Tests 20%
2. Textbook Work 20%
3. Speaking Activities 30%
4. Presentations 20%
5. Class Performance, Participation, and Assignments 10%

 Students must earn a grade of 60% or higher to pass this course.

1. Textbook Assessments
For each unit we will have quizzes and a test based on our textbook materials. These will include listening, grammar, and vocabulary assessments as well as the content of the text.

2. Speaking Activities
Speaking activities include class discussions, short speeches, and recordings that you make.

3. Presentations
During the semester you will prepare and give two short presentations. These will be face-to-face presentations.

4. Class Performance, Participation, and Assignments
Class performance and participation are assessments of your performance in class. Assignments include homework and preparation for classes. The instructor will provide details about this on the first day of class.
